title: Nvidia to release special chip for China, subverts US export controls
description:
The semiconductor chip developer Nvidia has launched a new China-focused chip that allows it access to the local market while still complying with export controls from the U.S.

Nvidia, one of the world’s most prominent artificial intelligence (AI) chip manufacturers, launched a new gaming chip on Dec. 28 aimed specifically at the Chinese market. 

According to a report from Reuters, Nvidia’s new advanced gaming chip offers its clients in China a “quantum leap in performance, efficiency and artificial intelligence-driven graphics” while still complying with export controls imposed by the United States government.

This is Nvidia’s first China-focused chip since the introduction of export controls on chips to China imposed by the Biden Administration in October 2022. Since their initial enforcement, the U.S. government has tightened controls on multiple occasions. 

Read more

title: South Korean lawmakers traded almost $100 million of crypto in 3 years
description:
South Korea’s Anti-Corruption and Civil Rights Commission investigated the digital asset transaction records of all 298 sitting lawmakers between May 30, 2020, and May 31, 2023.

Members of the South Korean parliament, the National Assembly, bought or sold almost $100 million in cryptocurrencies during a three-year period, according to a report published by the country’s Anti-Corruption and Civil Rights Commission on Dec. 29. 

The report follows a three-month investigation into the digital asset transaction records of all 298 sitting lawmakers between May 30, 2020, and May 31, 2023. The probe found that 18 out of 298 Korean lawmakers have records of digital asset possession in the last three years, while just 11 lawmakers account for the total volume traded during the period.

According to the report, the exact trade volume of crypto in lawmakers’ accounts is estimated to be 125.6 billion Korean won ($97.6 million). 

Read more

title: Breakthrough in Alzheimer’s Research: AI-Powered Wristband Sensor Model
description: In collaboration with Eisai Co., Ltd., Oita University has achieved a significant milestone in Alzheimer’s disease (AD) research.
